definition: to do things right/to use the correct method
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
Command right and you will be obeyed cheerfully. (idiom)
pinyin: zhi3 hui1 you3 fang1 , ren2 ren2 le4 cong2

sentences.english: The piece has an unfortunate headline: "Why Chinese Mothers Are Superior."
sentences.chinese: 为什么中国的母亲更教子有方？

sentences.english: Could you give me some advice on how to bring up my son properly?
sentences.chinese: 您能给我些建议如何才能教子有方呢？

sentences.english: The general manager thinks that the company can charge off its success to his leadership.
sentences.chinese: 总经理认为，这个公司之所以成功是由于他领导有方。

sentences.english: The Master said, "When your parents are alive, do not travel far."
sentences.chinese: 子岳，“父母在，不远游，游必有方。”

sentences.english: Parents, not to travel, swim will be well.
sentences.chinese: 父母在，不远游，游必有方。

sentences.english: In other words, face reality and be adult in your responses to life's challenges.
sentences.chinese: 面对生活的挑战，要老成持重，应付有方。

sentences.english: He is not only a good leader, but also an eloquent speaker.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅领导有方，而且口才出众。

sentences.english: The leadership and management of the school as a church school is good.
sentences.chinese: 学校领导对教会学校的引领与管理有方。

sentences.english: In a good house all is quickly ready.
Wen Youfang whistled quietly outside, and Trinket managed to slide softly out without Old Hai noticing.
sentences.chinese: 温有方轻轻吹了声口哨，韦小宝便溜了出去。

sentences.english: If you command wisely, youll be obeyed cheerfully.
sentences.chinese: 倘君指挥有方，人人欣然听命。

sentences.english: It speaks well for your teaching that all your pupils passed the examination.
sentences.chinese: 你的所有学生考试都及格，这证明你教导有方。

sentences.english: If you command wisely, youwoulll be obeyed cheerfully.
The manager thought that the shop could charge off his success to his leadership.
sentences.chinese: 经理认为商店之所以成功是由于他领导有方。

sentences.english: They are now well placed to reap the fruits of their good management.
sentences.chinese: 现在，这些企业恰好能够获得自身管理有方的成果。

sentences.english: Mrs Tan showed a good example to her descendants, remarkably with the right teachings.
sentences.chinese: 陈太太给子孙们树立了好榜样，真是教导有方。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to have attained the Way/(of a government or a ruler) enlightened/wise and just
prudent/cautious/to be in charge of ritual ceremonies/to hold an important office
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
